review_title: Beware: Failing School and Toxic Administration.
pros: Beautiful Campus! Free + convenient parking. Disregarding low pay across the board, the benefits are good.
cons: Administration refuses to give a desperately needed Cost Of Living Adjustment to staff and faculty, while the top administration enjoys yearly increased pay (search propublica site and you'll find it). The new president presents publicly as caring and fair, but one-on-one is a callous and condescending man who has zero respect for those who've held this place together for so many years. Despite staff pay, or the attitude of the new president, the school is actively failing as enrollment drops precipitously year over year. The school owes more to the bank than it has in its endowment. Avoid at all costs.

pros: Free parking Have cafeteria Good benefits
cons: Want you to train yourself but you have to guess what you should be learning with limited access and tools to do you your job. Raised the concern to supervisor to at least just give training for a couple of hours but just don't want to do it. There is no programming in Programmer. It is just technical support for 3rd party system that they acquired.

pros: Great university and extra special students
cons: Long hours but worth it all

pros: The Administration at Woodbury really try to keep everyone happy. They are thoughtful with decision making and will take input from staff.
cons: As a University, there are A LOT of hoops when they try to affect change.

review_title: Dead end,  no growth, I think if you feel like retiring but not yet; go there
pros: I would guess that it would be the free and close parking, and small campus
cons: We understand reasons why based on performance someone would get laid off, especially if it’s poor performance, but even if you have exceptional performance or great performance there is a high risk of you being laid off due to budget constraints. That is why it is a dead-end job with no prospects of growth

review_title: Very Political snd Refused to Honor Predecessor’s Terms

pros: Pretty campus, deserving students, Dedicated instructors
cons: Political, unreasonable expectations while withdrawing or refusing needed tools, sabotage

pros: Students were wonderful, and engaging.
cons: Work place was a toxic environment

pros: Great students, lots of heart and community

job_title: Fashion Lab Technician in Burbank, CA
pros: Flexible with schedules, willing to help with hours, the Fashion Design chair is a wonderful kind amazing person
cons: The office that handles student work applications is slow and prone to loosing paperwork

review_title: Adjuncts are the low man on the totem pole.
pros: If you love teaching it is a great place to meet eager motivated students many of whom are the first in their families to attend a college or university.
cons: Adjunct instructors are very poorly paid when compared to full time teachers.  They work longer hours and handle difficult classes without adequate compensation or benefits.

job_title: Computer Lab Tech in Redondo Beach, CA
pros:
-During my shifts, acting mostly autonomously with very little supervisor oversight. 
-If there was an issue a lab tech didn't know, and the supervisors were available, they'd be willing to help you out.
cons:
-Very little training. Training consisted of basic knowledge of Most of the knowledge I had to pick up was on the job, 
-Supervisors would be unavailable during night shifts. Meaning that if a lab tech had a question during this time period, no one would be available to answer those questions.

review_title: Horrible HR Department, Admissions Dept. - Poor knowledge.
pros: Location, relaxed environment.  Trying to update systems and procedures. Comfortable dress code, good art school and good professors.  Good parking.
cons: HR is horrible. Plays favoritism at the highest level. Shares inappropriate information with other employees. Admissions has low moral and staff is not organized or knowledgeable. They promote an environment which adds to workplace harrassment and racism.

pros: Absolutely great culture, helpful staff, school of architecture staff are nice, a family environment, I can't complain! Sad to see negative comment about HR, for me that's the best resource we have in campus, always helpful and professional! (Well, some employees may be angry/upset due to their own issues).
cons: Want to see more energetic atmosphere..

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Burbank, CA
pros: This is a beautiful campus. The labs are in good condition. The food for a campus is surprisingly good. The students I interacted with were wonderful.
cons: I was an adjunct faculty so that is always difficult. It would be nice if there were more opportunities for growth.

pros: Free Tuitiion, time off within a days notice, is mostly given.  Work load is reasonable.
cons: Not too many, just not really a place to be able to advance if that is what you want to do.

pros: Excellent experience and work environment. There was plenty to learn and work toward. The hours were flexible to my class schedule.
cons: There are no cons to this position. It was my job to assist peers and their projects when the time came.
